Property.name: Restrictions
Property.val: Please refer to the cancer protocol cover page (www.cap.org/cancerprotocols) for information about which tumor types and procedures can be reported using this template.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_15194
DisplayedItem.title: For bilateral tumors, complete a separate checklist for each kidney.

ListItem.name: LI_702251
ListItem.title: Pending - Completion of this CAP Cancer Protocol is awaiting expert consultation

ListItem.name: LI_702250
ListItem.title: Completed - This CAP Cancer Protocol or some elements have been performed following expert consultation

ListItem.name: LI_36740
ListItem.title: Congenital mesoblastic nephroma (cellular, classic, or mixed)

ListItem.name: LI_15249
ListItem.title: Malignant neoplasm, type cannot be determined (explain)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_15249_1
Property.val: Malignant neoplasm, type cannot be determined

Section.name: S_802490
Section.title: Greatest Dimension of Additional Tumors (for specimens with multiple tumors, repeat this section as needed)

Question.name: Q_802492
Question.title: ?Greatest Dimension of Additional Tumor in Centimeters (cm)

Question.name: Q_802562
Question.title: Evidence of Tumor Disruption (pre-operative rupture or intra-operative spillage) (Note D)

Question.name: Q_802566
Question.title: Renal Sinus Involvement by Viable Tumor

ListItem.name: LI_15267
ListItem.title: Minimal extension into renal sinus soft tissue (a single focus less than 5 mm in greatest dimension located greater than 5 mm from the nearest margin)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_15267_1
Property.val: Minimal extension into renal sinus soft tissue

ListItem.name: LI_20129
ListItem.title: More than minimal extension into renal sinus soft tissue

ListItem.name: LI_15268
ListItem.title: Involvement of renal sinus lymphovascular spaces

Question.name: Q_15232
Question.title: Renal Vein Involvement by Viable Tumor

Question.name: Q_36735
Question.title: Extension Beyond Renal Capsule by Viable Tumor

Question.name: Q_15235
Question.title: Direct Extension into Adjacent Organs by Viable Tumor

Question.name: Q_379098
Question.title: Posttherapy Histologic Classification of Favorable Histology Wilms Tumor

DisplayedItem.name: DI_36750
DisplayedItem.title: The histologic evidence of response to therapy may be used to guide further therapy for Wilms tumors. Therefore tumors that have previously undergone therapy should be given a posttherapy classification.

ListItem.name: LI_36752
ListItem.title: Low risk (no viable Wilms tumor present other than scattered nephroblastic tubules that may represent residual nephrogenic rest)

ListItem.name: LI_36755
ListItem.title: Intermediate risk, with viable tumor present comprising less than 33% of mass, regardless of histology

ListItem.name: LI_36756
ListItem.title: Intermediate risk, with viable tumor present comprising greater than 33% of mass and blastemal histology present in less than 66% of viable tumor

ListItem.name: LI_36759
ListItem.title: High risk (viable tumor greater than 33% of mass with blastemal histology present in greater than 66% of viable tumor)

ListItem.name: LI_804594
ListItem.title: All margins negative for viable and non-viable tumor

Question.name: Q_359410
Question.title: Distance from Tumor to Closest Margin

ListItem.name: LI_804595
ListItem.title: Tumor (viable or non-viable) present at margin

Question.name: Q_804596
Question.title: Margin(s) Involved by Viable or Non-Viable Tumor

ListItem.name: LI_14463
ListItem.title: Not applicable (no regional lymph nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.name: LI_804603
ListItem.title: All regional lymph nodes negative for viable and non-viable tumor

ListItem.name: LI_804604
ListItem.title: Tumor (viable or non-viable) present in regional lymph node(s)

Question.name: Q_14467
Question.title: Number of Lymph Nodes with Tumor

Question.name: Q_804611
Question.title: ?Distant Site(s) Involved by Viable or Non-Viable Tumor, if applicable

Property.name: p_rptTxt_804611_1
Property.val: Distant Site(s) Involved by Viable or Non-Viable Tumor

DisplayedItem.name: DI_17204
DisplayedItem.title: Distant metastasis includes both hematogenous metastasis or lymph node metastasis outside the abdomen-pelvic region (beyond the renal drainage system).

ListItem.name: LI_379107
ListItem.title: Lymph node(s) outside of the abdomino-pelvic region

Question.name: Q_15276
Question.title: Children’s Oncology Group Staging System for Pediatric Renal Tumors Other Than Renal Cell Carcinoma (Note F)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_15276_1
Property.val: Children’s Oncology Group Staging System for Pediatric Renal Tumors Other Than Renal Cell Carcinoma

DisplayedItem.name: DI_36765
DisplayedItem.title: Local stage must be assigned by the pathologist with the caveat that he or she may not be aware of clinical or radiographic information important in assigning the clinical or overall stage (i.e., presence of metastatic disease).

DisplayedItem.name: DI_57471
DisplayedItem.title: # Local Stage I requires all of the following to be true: No penetration of renal capsule by tumor identified, and; No tumor involvement of extrarenal or renal sinus lymph-vascular spaces identified, and; No tumor metastasis to lymph nodes identified

ListItem.name: LI_15298
ListItem.title: Local Stage I: Tumor limited to kidney and completely resected#

Property.name: p_rptTxt_15298_1
Property.val: Local Stage I: Tumor limited to kidney and completely resected

ListItem.name: LI_15299
ListItem.title: Local Stage II: Tumor extends beyond kidney but is completely resected, with negative surgical margins and negative regional lymph nodes

ListItem.name: LI_804626
ListItem.title: Tumor (viable) extends through the renal capsule or involves the perirenal fat or adrenal gland

ListItem.name: LI_804622
ListItem.title: Tumor (viable) involvement of extrarenal or renal sinus lymph-vascular spaces present

ListItem.name: LI_804621
ListItem.title: Tumor (viable) involves renal vein but has not been transected and is not attached to vein wall at resection margin

ListItem.name: LI_804625
ListItem.title: Tumor (viable) infiltrates the wall of the renal pelvis or the ureter

ListItem.name: LI_804623
ListItem.title: Tumor (viable) more than minimally involves the renal sinus soft tissue

ListItem.name: LI_15300
ListItem.title: Local Stage III: Residual tumor is suspected

ListItem.name: LI_804616
ListItem.title: Tumor (viable or non-viable) present at margin(s) of resection

ListItem.name: LI_804614
ListItem.title: Tumor spill (viable or non-viable) before or during surgery identified

ListItem.name: LI_804615
ListItem.title: Piecemeal excision of tumor viable or non-viable tumor (removal of tumor in more than 1 piece)

ListItem.name: LI_804617
ListItem.title: Metastatic tumor (viable or non-viable) in regional lymph node(s) identified

ListItem.name: LI_804618
ListItem.title: History of renal tumor biopsy before definitive surgery (pretherapy specimens only)

ListItem.name: LI_804620
ListItem.title: Tumor implants (viable or non-viable) present anywhere in the abdomen

DisplayedItem.name: DI_59114
DisplayedItem.title: # Stage IV requires hematogenous metastases or lymph node metastases outside the abdomino-pelvic region (beyond renal drainage system, e.g., lung, liver)

ListItem.name: LI_15302
ListItem.title: Stage V: Bilateral renal involvement at diagnosis

DisplayedItem.name: DI_36555
DisplayedItem.title: Each side should be staged separately in separate case summaries, according to above criteria, as stage I through IV)
